detail.title: Tab Navigation
detail.description: Use the Tab key to move focus between interactive elements on the page.

sections.heading: How it works
sections.content: Pressing Tab moves forward through buttons, links, and form fields. Hold Shift and press Tab to move backwards.

sections.heading: Best used for
sections.content: Navigating forms, jumping to action buttons, and accessing controls without a mouse.

shortcuts.title: Arrow Keys
shortcuts.summary: Switch between tabs (when tab is focused)

detail.title: Arrow Key Navigation
detail.description: Use arrow keys to switch between tabs when accessibility mode is enabled.

sections.heading: How it works
sections.content: When a tab button has focus, press Left/Right arrow keys to move between tabs. The selected tab will automatically activate.

sections.heading: Enabling this feature
sections.content: Go to Settings → Preferences and enable 'Enhanced Accessibility' to unlock arrow key navigation.

detail.title: Quick Tab Jumping
detail.description: Quickly jump to the first or last tab in the navigation.

sections.heading: How it works
sections.content: Press Home to jump to the first tab (Downloads), or End to jump to the last tab (Logs).

detail.title: Escape Key
detail.description: Close any open modal window or dialog with the Escape key.

sections.heading: Works with
sections.content: Video player, help modal, duplicate detection dialogs, and cookie upload modal.

detail.title: Button Activation
detail.description: Activate buttons and links using keyboard.

sections.heading: How it works
sections.content: When a button or link has focus (shown by an outline), press Space or Enter to activate it.

tips.title: Bulk Download
tips.summary: Select multiple files in the Browse Files tab and click "Download as ZIP" to get them all in one archive.

detail.title: Bulk Download with ZIP Archives
detail.description: Download multiple videos at once in a single ZIP file.

sections.heading: How to use
sections.content:
1. Go to the Browse Files tab
2. Check the boxes next to videos you want
3. Click 'Download as ZIP' button
4. Your browser will download a single ZIP file containing all selected videos

sections.heading: Tips
sections.content: This is great for downloading an entire collection or backing up multiple videos at once. The ZIP file will preserve original filenames.

tips.title: Copy URLs
tips.summary: Click on a domain name in the Download History to copy the original video URL to your clipboard.

detail.title: Quick URL Copying
detail.description: Copy original video URLs with a single click.

sections.heading: How to use
sections.content: In the Download History section, click on the colored domain badge (e.g., 'youtube.com', 'instagram.com'). The full URL is instantly copied to your clipboard.

sections.heading: Why it's useful
sections.content: Share URLs with friends, re-download from a different source, or keep a record of your downloaded content.

tips.title: Retry Failed Downloads
tips.summary: Failed downloads show a "Retry" button - click it to automatically fill the form with that URL.

detail.title: Retry Failed Downloads
detail.description: Quickly retry downloads that failed due to network issues or other problems.

sections.heading: How to use
sections.content:
1. Find a failed download in Download History
2. Click the 'Retry' button
3. The download form will automatically fill with the URL
4. Click 'Start Download' to try again

sections.heading: Common causes of failures
sections.content: Network timeouts, rate limiting, authentication required (try adding a cookie file), or the video was removed.

tips.title: Tools Shortcut
tips.summary: In the Browse Files tab, click the "Tools" button on any video to quickly jump to the Tools tab with that video preselected.

detail.title: Quick Tools Access
detail.description: Jump directly from a file to the Tools tab with that video preselected.

sections.heading: How to use
sections.content:
1. Go to Browse Files tab
2. Find the video you want to process
3. Click the 'Tools' button next to it
4. You'll be taken to the Tools tab with that video already selected

sections.heading: What you can do
sections.content: Convert videos to MP3, flip them horizontally/vertically, or rotate them 90/180/270 degrees.

tips.title: Auto-Cookie Selection
tips.summary: Enable "Auto-Select Cookies" in Preferences to automatically match cookie files to video platforms.

detail.title: Automatic Cookie Matching
detail.description: Automatically select the right cookie file based on the URL you're downloading.

sections.heading: How it works
sections.content: When you paste a URL, the system detects the domain (e.g., 'instagram.com') and automatically selects the matching cookie file (e.g., 'instagram.txt').

sections.heading: Setting it up
sections.content:
1. Upload cookie files in Settings → Cookie Files
2. Name them after the site (e.g., 'instagram.txt', 'youtube.txt')
3. Enable 'Auto-Select Cookies' in Settings → Preferences
4. The system will now auto-match cookies to URLs

sections.heading: Why use cookies
sections.content: Many sites require authentication to download private or age-restricted content. Cookie files let you download content as if you were logged in.

tips.title: Duplicate Detection
tips.summary: The system checks if you've already downloaded a URL and gives you options to skip duplicates or re-download.

detail.title: Smart Duplicate Detection
detail.description: Avoid downloading the same video twice with built-in duplicate detection.

sections.heading: How it works
sections.content: When you submit a download, the system checks if you've already downloaded that URL. If found, you'll see a dialog with options to skip or re-download.

sections.heading: Your options
sections.content:
• Skip: Don't download again
• Re-download: Download a fresh copy
• View existing: Jump to Browse Files tab to see the existing file

tips.title: Cancel Active Jobs
tips.summary: Click the "✕ Cancel" button on any active conversion to stop it and clean up partial files.

detail.title: Canceling Active Operations
detail.description: Stop conversions or transformations in progress and clean up partial files.

sections.heading: How to use
sections.content: In the Tools tab under 'Active Operations', click the '✕ Cancel' button next to any running job. The operation will stop and partial files will be cleaned up.

sections.heading: What happens
sections.content: The FFmpeg process is terminated, the job is marked as failed, and any partially-created files are automatically deleted.

tips.title: Hardware Acceleration
tips.summary: Check the Hardware Information section in Settings to see if your system has GPU acceleration available for faster video processing.

detail.title: GPU Hardware Acceleration
detail.description: Use your GPU to process videos much faster than CPU alone.

sections.heading: Checking your system
sections.content:
Go to Settings → Hardware Information to see detected acceleration technologies:
• NVENC (NVIDIA GPUs)
• AMF (AMD GPUs)
• QSV (Intel Quick Sync)
• VideoToolbox (macOS)
• VAAPI (Linux)

sections.heading: How it helps
sections.content: GPU acceleration can make video transformations 5-10x faster. The system will automatically use GPU encoding when available and fall back to CPU if needed.

sections.heading: Troubleshooting
sections.content: If acceleration is detected but jobs fail, the system will automatically retry with CPU encoding. Check the Logs tab for details.
